Record.ClassificationPath: Immune System Diseases/Immunoproliferative Disorders/Lymphoproliferative Disorders/Giant Lymph Node Hyperplasia
Hemic and Lymphatic Diseases/Lymphatic Diseases/Lymphoproliferative Disorders/Giant Lymph Node Hyperplasia
Record.Description: Large benign, hyperplastic lymph nodes. The more common hyaline vascular subtype is characterized by small hyaline vascular follicles and interfollicular capillary proliferations. Plasma cells are often present and represent another subtype with the plasma cells containing IgM and IMMUNOGLOBULIN A.
